wikipedia_page.main: George Ridley (1818 – 4 November 1887) was a British Liberal and Whig politician.The son of former Newcastle-upon-Tyne Whig MP Matthew Ridley and Laura née Hawkins, Ridley followed his father into politics, also as a Whig MP. After unsuccessfully contesting South Northumberland in 1852, he was elected for his father's former seat at a by-election in 1856—caused by the resignation of John Blackett due to ill health—and, becoming a Liberal in 1859, held the seat until 1860, when he resigned after being appointed a Copyhold, Inclosure and Tithe Commissioner.

response: * George Ridley (Labour politician) (1886–1944), British Member of Parliament
* George Ridley (Whig politician) (1818–1887), British Member of Parliament
*George Ridley (Whig politician) (1818–1887), Member of Parliament for Newcastle-upon-Tyne 1856–1860
*George Ridley (Labour politician) (1886–1944), Member of Parliament for Clay Cross 1936–1944
